description: Third pass of intellectual genealogy: synthesizes the evolution of a single idea across multiple prior works where it was found. If idea X appears in works 1, 3, and 7, this pass traces the evolution from 1 to 3 to 7 to the current work. Runs once per idea that appears in 2+ prior works.
researcher_question: How has this idea evolved across the author's body of work, and what does the trajectory reveal?

canonical_schema.idea_name: string - concise name of the idea being traced

evolution_timeline.form: string - how the idea appeared in this work
evolution_timeline.transition_to_next: string - what changed between this work and the next in the timeline

current_form.description: string - how the idea appears in the current (most recent) work
current_form.key_quote: string - most representative quote from the current work

canonical_schema.evolution_narrative: string - 2-3 paragraph narrative of how this idea evolved across the author's body of work
canonical_schema.intermediate_influences: string - what external events, intellectual encounters, or historical changes may have driven changes between works
canonical_schema.what_was_gained: string - what the evolution added in terms of analytical power, scope, or precision
canonical_schema.what_was_lost: string - what was present in earlier versions but abandoned, narrowed, or forgotten

meta.works_in_timeline: number - how many works this idea appears in
meta.total_span_years: string - time span from earliest to current appearance

extraction.core_question: How has this specific idea evolved across the author's body of work?
extraction_steps: RECONSTRUCT TIMELINE: Arrange all appearances of this idea chronologically across the author's prior works
TRACE TRANSITIONS: For each transition from one work to the next, identify what changed — in emphasis, scope, framing, evidence base, or conclusion
CLASSIFY PATTERN: Determine the overall evolution pattern — is this gradual refinement, sharp reversal, silent drift, strategic reframing, or consistent deepening?
WRITE NARRATIVE: Compose a 2-3 paragraph narrative that tells the story of this idea's evolution
ASSESS WHAT CHANGED: Identify what was gained (new analytical power, broader scope) and what was lost (nuance, qualification, alternative framings)
CONSIDER EXTERNAL FACTORS: What intellectual encounters, historical events, or career pressures might explain the transitions?
extraction.special_instructions: Focus on the TRAJECTORY, not just individual appearances. The value is in seeing the arc of development. Pay special attention to what drove transitions — was it new evidence, changing political context, intellectual influence, or strategic positioning? Be honest about what was lost in evolution, not just what was gained.

id_examples.to: 'Automation thesis' evolution: tentative hypothesis (2015) → central claim (2019) → foundational premise (2025)

concretization.naming_guidance: Use idea name with evolution pattern summary
